text:
The Tcl based build system for rivet seems to be broken -- or else I'm
overlooking something very fundamental. The compilation aborts as follows:
mod_rivet.so    -> Command (sh):  -o mod_rivet.so apache_multipart_buffer.o
apache_request.o rivetChannel.o rivetParser.o rivetCore.o mod_rivet.o
TclWebapache.o -L/usr/lib -ltcl8.4 -ldl  -lieee -lm
Compilation failed on command "couldn't execute "-o": no such file or directory"

This is true for both the current and 0.3 tarballs. Inspecting the config.tcl
file I see that none of the variables ($TCL_SHLIB_LD, etc) for the calls to
perform the linkage are defined. This seems to be what breaks the compile. My
attempts to define these variables only produced copious warnings and errors, oh
well. The compile, for what it is worth, did proceed past the original point of
failure. Not much past, to be sure, but it did go past. 

I did, however, get the cvs-snapshot (with only a small amount of cussing and
screeching) to compile and, unless there is some well hidden flaw, I seem to be
'good to go'.
